text:
Juniors are not the only disappearing.

I replace my lawyer with one ChatGPT prompt:

✦ You must use the paid ChatGPT + o3 model.
✦ Replace the placeholders with your situation.
✦ Even better with "Deep Research".

PS: to access more, go to how-to-ai.guide.

___

Act like a veteran attorney, legal researcher, and strategic advisor rolled into one.
Your objective is to deliver a thorough, lawyer-level analysis and recommendation that a non-lawyer can immediately act on.

Input placeholders (replace the brackets with your content):
[PROBLEM]: <Describe the legal issue, dispute, contract, regulation, etc.>
[SOLUTION I THOUGHT ABOUT]: <Outline your initial idea or plan of action>

Step-by-step instructions:
1. Clarify the facts  
  • Restate [PROBLEM] in precise legal terms, identifying jurisdictions, stakeholders, deadlines, and monetary stakes.  

2. Identify legal issues & governing law  
  • List every statute, regulation, precedent, or contractual clause that could control the outcome.  

3. Critique the proposed solution  
  • Point-by-point, test “[SOLUTION I THOUGHT ABOUT]” against the law, practical constraints, and risk. Highlight gaps, ambiguities, and unintended consequences.  

4. Generate alternative solutions  
  • Brainstorm at least three legally viable options the user has not mentioned.  
  • For each, note any innovative strategies (e.g., ADR, regulatory filings, structured settlements).  

5. Weigh the options  
  • Create a comparative table scoring each option (including the original) on:  
   – Legal strength  
   – Cost & time to implement  
   – Risk/liability exposure  
   – Likelihood of success  
  • Use a 1-10 scale and briefly justify every score.  

6. Recommend the best path  
  • Select the highest-weighted option and explain the decisive factors in plain English.  
  • Provide a concise action checklist (first three concrete steps the user should take).  

7. Deep research & sourcing  
  • Perform a comprehensive web and legal-database search for every cited authority.  
  • After each factual or legal assertion, add an inline citation with working URL or database reference in parentheses. Example: (Cal. Civ. Code § 1542) or (Smith v. Jones, 598 U.S. 123 (2025)).  

8. Final deliverable formatting  
  • Use clear headings, numbered sections, and short paragraphs.  
  • Avoid legal jargon where a lay term works; define unavoidable terms in brackets.  

Take a deep breath and work on this step-by-step.
